revised_title: Characterization and Properties of Black Matter in Bronchial Glands and Lungs
tldr: The author examines the black matter found in bronchial glands and lungs, concluding that it is animal charcoal. They propose that this charcoal is introduced into the respiratory system through the air and is absorbed by lymphatic vessels, which transport it to the bronchial glands, causing them to turn black or dark blue. This discovery could have implications for understanding pulmonary consumption and the overall functioning of the respiratory system.
